medical_history.chief_complaint: RUQ post-prandial abdominal pain radiating under the ribs and to the back.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 30 hours prior to presentation, with a history of numerous episodes over the last few months, occurring up to three times a week. This episode has persisted, accompanied by nonbilious, nonbloody vomiting, and chills. No chest pain or shortness of breath reported.
medical_history.past_medical_history: White coat hypertension, obesity, superficial skin infections (bacterial and fungal), impetigo, migraines, seasonal allergies.
